text: [Music]
if it feels like you're being charged
more every time you get to a checkout or
every time a bill lands on your doorstep
that's because you are the cost of
everything that we buy is going up at
the fastest rate for 30 years there are
two big reasons for this the first one
is the really really expensive energy
bills that we're all facing for gas and
electricity the second reason is is fuel
costs which are high watering at the
moment every time you try and fill up a
tank that is the baseline of our economy
that means that it's more expensive to
produce everything that we buy and to
get it to us to the shelves or to our
front doors so businesses are passing on
those costs to us as customers that
means that the food that we buy from the
basics
to your lunch and especially
fresh fruit and veg is getting really
expensive at the moment all those costs
are being passed straight to us but
everything is going up household goods
too anything that's coming to you in a
plastic bottle will be getting more
expensive because it's more expensive to
make but it's not just the things that
we physically buy if you're going out to
a restaurant if you're having a night
out if you're booking a holiday if
you're staying in a hotel if you're
getting your hair cut all of those
things will be getting a lot more
expensive over the coming months there
is some help available for those most in
need for help with their energy costs
but for the rest of us we're just going
to have to get used to this really high
level of inflation because it's set to
stay for the coming months right through
you
